Now a days devices are coming with more security in context of Battery power consumption. By default device keep almost all apps in power saving mode. \nIt means in some devices your background services (Location, Alarm Manager) won\'t work in the background, in some devices background tasks won\'t work after a battery threshold limit (like 15%) . \nSo you need to exclude MediTrack from this battery saving mode to execute smoothly even in background.

You can do this for different manufacturer as .. 1. For Xiomi —> Go to the battery -> Power —> App battery saver —> MediTrack —> Now select "No restrictions" (for Background settings) then Allow option for Background location —> To AutoStart your app after Boot —> Go to the Security app —> permissions —> Auto start and check your app. 2. For Samsung —> Go to the Samsung Smart Manager app —> Battery —> Detail (App power saving panel) —> click MediTrack and select disable. For other devices there should be same power options either in settings option directly or some app is installed by default to handle it.
Why to enable MediTrack to execute as Background Service ?
Disable Power Saving mode for MediTrack to work. Allow it to execute as Background Service
